content.1: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valour, and he
content.2: And Gilead’s wife bare him sons; and his wife’s sons grew up, and they thrust out Jephthah, and said unto him, Thou shalt not inherit in our father’s house; for thou
content.3: Then Jephthah fled from his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain men to Jephthah, and went out with him.
content.4: And it came to pass in process of time, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel.
content.5: And it was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to fetch Jephthah out of the land of Tob:
content.6: And they said unto Jephthah, Come, and be our captain, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.
content.7: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, Did not ye hate me, and expel me out of my father’s house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?
content.8: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, Therefore we turn again to thee now, that thou mayest go with us, and fight against the children of Ammon, and be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
content.9: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, If ye bring me home again to fight against the children of Ammon, and the
content.10: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, The
content.11: Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and captain over them: and Jephthah uttered all his words before the
content.12: And Jephthah sent messengers unto the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What hast thou to do with me, that thou art come against me to fight in my land?
content.13: And the king of the children of Ammon answered unto the messengers of Jephthah, Because Israel took away my land, when they came up out of Egypt, from Arnon even unto Jabbok, and unto Jordan: now therefore restore those
content.14: And Jephthah sent messengers again unto the king of the children of Ammon:
content.15: And said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah, Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon:
content.16: But when Israel came up from Egypt, and walked through the wilderness unto the Red sea, and came to Kadesh;
content.17: Then Israel sent messengers unto the king of Edom, saying, Let me, I pray thee, pass through thy land: but the king of Edom would not hearken
content.18: Then they went along through the wilderness, and compassed the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, but came not within the border of Moab: for Arnon
content.19: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said unto him, Let us pass, we pray thee, through thy land into my place.
content.20: But Sihon trusted not Israel to pass through his coast: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and pitched in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
content.22: And they possessed all the coasts of the Amorites, from Arnon even unto Jabbok, and from the wilderness even unto Jordan.
content.24: Wilt not thou possess that which Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess? So whomsoever the
content.26: While Israel dwelt in Heshbon and her towns, and in Aroer and her towns, and in all the cities that
content.27: Wherefore I have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the
content.28: Howbeit the king of the children of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah which he sent him.
content.30: And Jephthah vowed a vow unto the
content.31: Then it shall be, that whatsoever cometh forth of the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, shall surely be the
content.32: So Jephthah passed over unto the children of Ammon to fight against them; and the
content.33: And he smote them from Aroer, even till thou come to Minnith,
content.34: And Jephthah came to Mizpeh unto his house, and, behold, his daughter came out to meet him with timbrels and with dances: and she
content.35: And it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent his clothes, and said, Alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art one of them that trouble me: for I have opened my mouth unto the
content.36: And she said unto him, My father,
content.37: And she said unto her father, Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may go up and down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my fellows.
content.38: And he said, Go. And he sent her away
content.39: And it came to pass at the end of two months, that she returned unto her father, who did with her
